Package org.bk.ass.bt

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AcquireLock<T>
    Leaf node that will succeed if the supplied lock can be acquired.
    BehaviorTree
    A behavior tree.
    Best
    Will execute the child with maximum utility first like Selector.
    CompoundNode
    Base class for non-leaf nodes.
    Condition
    Node that will succeed if the given check passed, fails otherwise.
    Decorator
    Base class for nodes that delegate execution and modify the delegate or the status.
    Distributor<T>
    This is like map for streams.
    ExecutionContext
    Can be used to create tree stack traces and log performance numbers of nodes.
    Inverter
    Delegates execution but returns the inverted status (ie. failed → success; success → failed; running → running).
    LambdaNode
    Allows inline nodes using lambdas.
    Memo
    Most nodes of ASS are reactive (they will execute no matter what the last execution result was).
    Parallel
    Using a Parallel.Policy, a behavior similar to Sequence or Selector.
    Repeat
    Repeatedly ticks a delegate node.
    Selector
    Reactive Selector node: Every time Selector.exec(ExecutionContext) is called all nodes are executed in order.
    Sequence
    Reactive Sequence node: Every time Sequence.exec(ExecutionContext) is called all nodes are executed in order.
    Succeeder
    Never fails, even if the delegate fails.
    TreeNode
    Base class of all of ASS' behavior trees.
    Wait
    Node which always is in status NodeStatus.RUNNING.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    NodeStatus
    Status of a node.
    Parallel.Policy  
    Repeat.Policy
